docs.snippet: A Texas woman was sentenced to five years in prison for voting in the 2016 presidential election when she was ineligible because she was on probation.

headline.print_headline: Texas Woman Sentenced 5 Years for Voting While on Probation
headline.main: Texas Woman Sentenced 5 Years for Voting While on Probation

docs.snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency has exempted one of the nation's largest oil refining companies, Andeavor, from complying with U.S. biofuels regulations - a waiver historically reserved for tiny operations in danger of going belly up, two sour...

headline.print_headline: Exclusive: EPA Gives Giant Refiner a 'Hardship' Waiver From Regulation
headline.main: Exclusive: EPA Gives Giant Refiner a 'Hardship' Waiver From Regulation

docs.snippet: The Chinese industry body which recommended targeting scrap aluminium in retaliatory trade action against the United States is already exploring what other measures could be taken, an official said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: China Metals Group Eyeing New Counter-Measures in U.S. Trade Row
headline.main: China Metals Group Eyeing New Counter-Measures in U.S. Trade Row

docs.snippet: The U.S. ambassador to Israel on Thursday said he was misquoted in an Israeli report in which he warned that Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas could become irrelevant if he keeps shunning the United States as a Mideast broker.

headline.print_headline: US Ambassador Says He Was Misquoted on Palestinians
headline.main: US Ambassador Says He Was Misquoted on Palestinians

docs.snippet: Lawmakers must approve the bill by midnight Friday to avoid a government shutdown this weekend, which would be the third closing this year.

headline.print_headline: Leaders in Congress Reach an Agreement To Spend $1.3 Trillion
headline.main: Congressional Leaders Agree on $1.3 Trillion Spending Bill as Deadline Looms

docs.snippet: Judge Tanya S. Chutkan allowed a case to proceed as a class action, suggesting that the government’s policies infringed on the teenagers’ constitutional rights.

headline.print_headline: Judge Temporarily Stops U.S. From Blocking Undocumented Teenagers’ Abortions
headline.main: Judge Temporarily Stops U.S. From Blocking Undocumented Teenagers’ Abortions

docs.snippet: Peace talks are the only way to end the war in Afghanistan. They also will probably not succeed.

headline.main: Tell the Truth About Our Longest War

docs.snippet: The family of a Florida man who died soon after his dream wedding to his high school sweetheart is upset after his widow scattered his ashes.

headline.print_headline: Family of Teen Who Died of Cancer Battle Widow Over Ashes
headline.main: Family of Teen Who Died of Cancer Battle Widow Over Ashes

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: Winter Storm, Texas, Stormy Daniels: Your Wednesday Briefing

docs.snippet: The U.S. military has announced Sunday that it launched an airstrike that killed five extremist militants in central Somalia.

headline.print_headline: US Says Its Airstrike Kills 5 Militants in Central Somalia
headline.main: US Says Its Airstrike Kills 5 Militants in Central Somalia
